title: FTBFS in testing, but not in unstable

sentences.text: When I build this package in testing, I get this:
ldap.c:56:18: error: array type has incomplete element type
ldap.c:72:19: error: array type has incomplete element type
dpkg-buildpackage: error: debian/rules build gave error exit status 2
In unstable, in a cowbuilder environment, it builds fine.
Maybe this is some kind of transition issue and it'd be best to wait it out.
But maybe in fact, a build dependency needs to be tightened or something, so I  figured I'd better point it out.
> When I build this package in testing, I get this:
> ldap.c:56:18: error: array type has incomplete element type > ldap.c:72:19: error: array type has incomplete element type > make[4]: *** [ldap.lo] Error 1
> dpkg-buildpackage: error: debian/rules build gave error exit status 2
> In unstable, in a cowbuilder environment, it builds fine.
> Maybe this is some kind of transition issue and it'd be best to wait it out.
> But maybe in fact, a build dependency needs to be tightened or something, so I  > figured I'd better point it out.

Since it built fine earlier on and does again now in unstable, I would  assume it is not a dependency being too old but some specific version of  e.g. libldap or gcc that is in the middle of a transition e.g. towards  proper handling of security flags.
Did you test in a clean cowbuilder testing environment?
On fre, 2011-10-14 at 11:55 +0200, Jonas Smedegaard wrote:
> > When I build this package in testing, I get this:
> > ldap.c:56:18: error: array type has incomplete element type > > ldap.c:72:19: error: array type has incomplete element type > > make[4]: *** [ldap.lo] Error 1
> > dpkg-buildpackage: error: debian/rules build gave error exit status 2
> > In unstable, in a cowbuilder environment, it builds fine.
> > Maybe this is some kind of transition issue and it'd be best to wait it out.
> > But maybe in fact, a build dependency needs to be tightened or something, so I  > > figured I'd better point it out.

> Since it built fine earlier on and does again now in unstable, I would  > assume it is not a dependency being too old but some specific version of  > e.g. libldap or gcc that is in the middle of a transition e.g. towards  > proper handling of security flags.
This problem still exists in current testing.
> Did you test in a clean cowbuilder testing environment?
No, I built it on my desktop, but that should work, too.
> On fre, 2011-10-14 at 11:55 +0200, Jonas Smedegaard wrote:
> > > When I build this package in testing, I get this:
> > > ldap.c:56:18: error: array type has incomplete element type > > > ldap.c:72:19: error: array type has incomplete element type > > > make[4]: *** [ldap.lo] Error 1
> > > dpkg-buildpackage: error: debian/rules build gave error exit status 2
> > > In unstable, in a cowbuilder environment, it builds fine.
> > > Maybe this is some kind of transition issue and it'd be best to  > > > wait it out.
But maybe in fact, a build dependency needs to be  > > > tightened or something, so I figured I'd better point it out.

> > Since it built fine earlier on and does again now in unstable, I  > > would assume it is not a dependency being too old but some specific  > > version of e.g. libldap or gcc that is in the middle of a transition  > > e.g. towards proper handling of security flags.
> This problem still exists in current testing.
Failing at same spot consistently, or more random?
> > Did you test in a clean cowbuilder testing environment?
> No, I built it on my desktop, but that should work, too.
Should, yes, assuming your system is pure single-branched Debian.
more difficult to narrow down what is the cause of the problem...
Please provide a list of package version of all installed packages.
OK, the problem is having libldap2-dev installed but not libacl1-dev.
Because of that, configure sets HAVE_LDAP to yes but HAVE_ACLS to undefined, this causes ldap.c to be built,
but ./include/atalk/ldapconfig.h defines nothing, and hence struct ldap_pref and struct pref_array are undefined, leading to the compiler error.
You should either add a build dependency on libacl1-dev or a build conflict against libldap2-dev.
> OK, the problem is having libldap2-dev installed but not libacl1-dev.
> Because of that, configure sets HAVE_LDAP to yes but HAVE_ACLS to  > undefined, this causes ldap.c to be built, but
> ldap_pref and struct pref_array are undefined, leading to the compiler  > error.
> You should either add a build dependency on libacl1-dev or a build  > conflict against libldap2-dev.
Thanks for the analysis, I'll fix this in the packaging.

Seems this is _not_ an underlying problem of libldap2-dev needing a  dependency on libacl1-dev, but _is_ one of netatalk upstream either  needing tightening of requirement resolving in configure script or  untangling in its code structures.
Do you feel that I understood that correctly?
On tis, 2012-03-20 at 21:22 +0100, Jonas Smedegaard wrote:

> Seems this is _not_ an underlying problem of libldap2-dev needing a  > dependency on libacl1-dev, but _is_ one of netatalk upstream either  > needing tightening of requirement resolving in configure script or  > untangling in its code structures.
It appears to be that way.
> > OK, the problem is having libldap2-dev installed but not libacl1-dev.
> > Because of that, configure sets HAVE_LDAP to yes but HAVE_ACLS to  > > undefined, this causes ldap.c to be built, but
> > ldap_pref and struct pref_array are undefined, leading to the compiler
> > You should either add a build dependency on libacl1-dev or a build  > > conflict against libldap2-dev.
> Thanks for the analysis, I'll fix this in the packaging.

> Seems this is _not_ an underlying problem of libldap2-dev needing a  > dependency on libacl1-dev, but _is_ one of netatalk upstream either  > needing tightening of requirement resolving in configure script or  > untangling in its code structures.
> Do you feel that I understood that correctly?
Ah - apparently already fixed upstream in version 2.2.2.
We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of netatalk, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:
A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.
If you have further comments please address them to 645290@bugs.debian.org, and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Jonas Smedegaard <dr@jones.dk> (supplier of updated netatalk package)
(This message was generated automatically at their request;
if you believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)
* Drop patch cherry-picked upstream: Included in new upstream release.
* Build-depend on libldap2-dev and libacl1-dev, to enable LDAP support      and support for extended ACLs (and possibly avoid FTBFS).
Thanks to Peter Eisentraut and masc.
+ Fix double-indent in Copyright fields as per Policy 5.6.13.
+ Add Files paragraph for ACL code.
* Update copyright file: Add disclaimer to License paragraph      GAP~Makefile.in.
* Add patch 101 to start avahi-daemon (if available) before atalkd.      Recommend avahi-daemon.
